author: Ignacio Aguirre Franco
description: Ignacio Aguirre Franco, CMO at Bitget, the world’s largest universal exchange (UEX), examines why the next generation of crypto trading depends on hybrid CeFi-DeFi models. Aguirre Franco explains how interoperability, unified workflows and shared liquidity are enabling safer, more efficient and seamless trading, unlocking the full potential of both traditional and crypto-native assets.
title: The Future of Crypto Trading Is Hybrid: CeFi and DeFi Unite

author: Anne Katrine Carlsson Sejr
description: Anne Katrine Carlsson Sejr, co-author of Maneuvering Monday and leader of teams specializing in organizational development and transformation, explains why the future of effective change depends not on chasing novelty, but on leveraging the assets a company already owns. Sejr argues that people, processes and relationships are the hidden engines of transformation, and that organizations must illuminate and amplify what already works to achieve sustainable impact.
title: The Next Big Transformation Strategy: Rediscovering Your Existing Assets

author: Dan Duray
description: The exhibition makes the case that the artist's influence would have been unavoidable regardless of fame or circumstance.
title: One Fine Show: “Yoko Ono, Music of the Mind” at MCA Chicago

author: Darren Foldes
description: Darren Foldes, Emmy-winning producer and partner at the commercial production company Sibling Rivalry, examines why California’s decision to expand tax credits for film and television while excluding commercial production represents a critical gap in the state’s creative strategy. Foldes argues that commercial advertising is a fast-moving economic engine that employs thousands of Californians, and that without targeted incentives, the state risks losing a foundational part of its creative ecosystem to competing markets.
title: Why California’s Future as a Creative Capital Depends on Commercial Production

author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
description: McDonald’s exit comes as Lululemon battles slowing U.S. sales, rising tariffs and mounting founder criticism.
title: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald Steps Down as Founder Decries Brand’s ‘Loss of Cool’

author: Nili Lotan
description: Nili Lotan, the New York-based designer and founder of her eponymous brand, has spent more than two decades building a label grounded in authenticity, intuition and cultural storytelling. In this Expert Insights Q&A, Lotan explores why experience, narrative and personal resonance—not scarcity or price—define modern luxury, and how music, art and design inform both her creative process and brand strategy.
title: The New Luxury: Why Story, Experience and Authenticity Matter More Than Exclusivity

author: Paul Jebara
description: Six smart upgrades that take you past ugly sweaters and beat-up sneakers, with dialed-in tailoring, better fabrics, and outfits built to survive overcrowded rooms, bad lighting and way too many photos.
title: The Grown Man’s Guide to Holiday Party Style

author: Dan Duray
description: In conversation with Observer, the artist reflects on her first solo museum exhibition in the United States, which she says was shaped by trust, time and creative freedom.
title: How Uman Channeled a Turbulent Year Into Calm Abstraction

author: Mya Ward
description: The piece’s enculturation rests on a certainty in its own semiotics—a stalwart belief that no matter the audience, grieving should be collective, not singular.
title: Elia Arce’s ‘No Time to Mourn (An Excerpt)’ Is a Monument to Grief

author: Allie Lebos
description: Whether you want to sport your favorite gown at a midnight masquerade or start the year with intention setting at a coastal-inspired countdown, these are the most glamorous New Year’s Eve celebrations in Los Angeles.
title: Where to Find the Most Glamorous New Year’s Eve Celebrations in Los Angeles
